intro: Nycterium vespertilio, commonly known as the evening bat plant, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae, which includes other nightshade-related plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Nycterium vespertilio is known for its nocturnal pollination, attracting moths and other night-active insects.
